command.name: CREATE
command.description: Commands to create tables. Input includes table name, column descriptions (names and data types), and constraints (PRIMARY KEY, FOREIGN KEY, UNIQUE, NOT NULL, CHECK).

command.name: ALTER
command.description: Commands to modify the structure of existing tables. Input includes table name, columns to modify, new column names, and new constraints.
command.example: ALTER TABLE students ADD COLUMN email STRING;

command.name: DROP
command.description: Commands to delete tables. Input includes the name of the table to be deleted.

command.name: SELECT
command.description: Commands to retrieve data from tables. Input includes table name, list of columns to select, filter conditions, sorting parameters, and row limit.
command.example: SELECT name, age FROM students WHERE grade = 'A' ORDER BY age;

command.name: INSERT
command.description: Commands to insert data into tables. Input includes table name, list of columns, and corresponding values.
command.example: INSERT INTO students (name, age, grade) VALUES ('John Doe', 20, 'A');

command.name: UPDATE
command.description: Commands to update data in tables. Input includes table name, columns to update, new values, and filter conditions.
command.example: UPDATE students SET grade = 'B' WHERE name = 'John Doe';

command.name: DELETE
command.description: Commands to delete data from tables. Input includes table name and filter conditions to determine which records to delete.

command.name: BEGIN
command.description: Commands to start a transaction. Input may include transaction labels or other parameters if necessary.

command.name: COMMIT
command.description: Commands to commit a transaction. Input includes confirmation of transaction completion.

command.name: ROLLBACK
command.description: Commands to roll back a transaction. Input includes specifying the transaction to be rolled back.

command.name: CONSTRAINTS
command.description:
Constraints and Validation: Input data for insertion and update are checked for compliance with established constraints. data types:
- INTEGER, - STRING, - BOOLEAN, - REAL.
integrity constraints:
- NOT NULL, - UNIQUE, - PRIMARY KEY, - FOREIGN KEY, - CHECK.
by default all constraints have name like 'constraint_name_column_constraint'
